tweets.text: Saturday at dawn. Time for an exercise walk from home. 8.7 miles covered in the upper @KentishStourCP valley west of Ashford. Revealed: no penalties issued under 'useless' UK farm pollution laws 

 - @EnvAgency has not prosecuted or fined any of 243 documented violations since 2018

 - EA funding fell by 63% between 2009 and 2019

We have issued a flood warning for the Dorset coast at #Swanage Bay. Flooding is expected for: The High Street, The Square, The Parade and The Mowlem. Strong easterly winds are causing large waves to break over the harbour wall. #Floodaware https://t.co/L5No7fQ6Gn

tweets.text: Councils and people now leading against pollution and water industry and @EnvAgency  still resisting change. https://t.co/MBowgsuszS

@CumbriaRain @EnvAgencyNW @metoffice Wow! Love this stuff Martin! For a land-locked southerner like me, 967mm in a single month is quite amazing (and I visit the Lakes pretty often...!). Now let's get a sensor atop Scafell Pike and see what we get...!

Some of the Farming Rules for Water are virtually unenforceable and @EnvAgency lacks the capacity to monitor compliance. The story here is the low number of recorded breaches when our rivers are in such a dire state. https://t.co/X2jjMCN4la
